title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 920.4 - Selection considerations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 920.4 - Selection considerations

State Regulations

The department's evaluation process for the selection of
grantees emphasizes the ability of the program operator to accomplish the
project based upon the following: (a) administrative capability to operate a program as demonstrated by past
performance on pertinent and related programs, or by the content of the
proposal; (b) fiscal
responsibility; (c) the
innovativeness of the proposal; (d) the expected improvement in the delivery of services within the area served by
the substate grantee(s) affected; (e) the extent to which elements of the
proposal may be replicated in other service areas within the State; (f) the degree to which the program operator
has made provision for coordination with other services and resources available
within the State and/or local geographic area; (g) safeguards taken to avoid duplication of
services available through existing resources; (h) coordination with local and central labor
organizations, economic development programs, and educational institutions, as
appropriate; (i) availability to
begin program start-up on or before December 31st of the year in which the

Request for Proposal is made and to expend funds awarded by June 30th of the
following year; (j) ability to meet
fiscal and administrative responsibilities set forth in title III of the JTPA (
29 USC
A section 1651 et seq.). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
920.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
